feed.title: O'Brien Family Cookbook
feed.subtitle: A collection of cooking recipes from the O'Brien family

entry.title: Uncle Tom's Jambalaya
entry.summary:
During Uncle Tom’s 30th Birthday in NOLA we all took a cajun cooking class. From that class came this recipe.
Yields 6 Servings.
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons peanut oil, divided 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning 10 ounces andouille sausage, sliced into

entry.title: Chicken with Lime-Cilantro Rice
entry.summary:
Made this delicious Lime-Cilantro-RIce Saturday. Both Dad and I loved it. I made it with sautéed/simmered chicken breast. Added pickled red onions. Oh my. Delicious. I think it is worthy of inclusion in our Cookbook.
For the chicken, I seared one

entry.title: Pancakes
entry.summary:
We’ve been going through a pancake phase lately and these are quite good.
Makes ~8 very large pancakes.
Ingredients:
Dry Mix:
385g All Purpose Flour 50g sugar 10g salt 11g Baking Powder 5g Baking Soda
Wet Mix:
460ml/g Milk 50ml/g Vegetable

entry.title: Graham Crack
entry.summary:
A Fox family favorite.
Ingredients:
Enough graham crackers or digestives to cover the pan 1 cup unsalted butter 1 cup light brown sugar, packed ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips 1/3 cup toffee bits (optional) 1/3 cup

entry.title: Detroit Style Pizza
entry.summary:
For Christmas last year Madeline bought me a LloydsPan Detroit Style Pizza Pan which I use for this recipe.
You can probably use another type of pan that’s roughly the same dimensions.
This recipe calls for Brick cheese, which is a cheese available

entry.title: Pizza Sauce, 3 Ways
entry.summary:
All sauces come directly from Ken Forkish’s The Elements of Pizza, which is an excellent book for learning about pizza.
